definition: four horse military chariot (archaic)/four (archaic)/generic term for history books
to ride/to mount/to make use of/to avail oneself of/to take advantage of/to multiply (math.)/Buddhist sect or creed
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
to enter by exploiting a weak spot (idiom); to take advantage of a lapse

sentences.english: Don't exhaust yourself or minor health problems will set in.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓自己太疲憊，否則健康問題會乘虛而入的。

sentences.english: This in turn will take advantage of the extreme forces of convenience.
sentences.chinese: 這又會給極端勢力乘虛而入帶來便利。

sentences.english: Praise shames me, for I secretly beg for it.
sentences.chinese: 榮耀使我感到羞愧，因爲我的虛榮打算乘虛作亂。

sentences.english: Typhoid fever sneaks in when sanitation fails.
sentences.chinese: 環境衛生搞不好，傷寒就會乘虛而入。

sentences.english: One day Jiang Wei led his soldiers to seize army provisions. The soldiers of the Shu State took advantage of this and seized the city.
sentences.chinese: 一日帶兵劫糧，蜀兵乘虛取冀城。

sentences.english: Seniors swoop in as young chicks enter their first year in college.
sentences.chinese: 小妞們剛開始大學第一年的生活，學長們就乘虛而入。
